sen.j: 高野家（たかのけ）は、日本の氏族（公家）。
sen.e: The Takano family was a Japanese clan (court noble).
The Takano family was a Japanese clan (court nobles).
The Takano family was a Japanese clan (court nobles).

sen.j: 藤原北家中御門流持明院家庶家。
sen.e: It was a collateral branch of the Jimyoin family of the Nakamikado line of the Northern House of the FUJIWARA clan.
It was a collateral branch of the Jimyoin family of the Nakamikado line of the Northern House of the FUJIWARA clan.
It was a collateral branch of the Jimyoin family of the Nakamikado line of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan.
A new family.
A new family.
A new family.
The family rank was Urinke.
The family rank was Urinke.
The family rank was Urinke.

sen.j: 家紋は杏葉（持明院家と同じ）。
sen.e: The family crest was 'Double Balloonflower' as that of the Jimyoin family.
The family crest was a 'Double Balloonflower' like that of the Jimyoin family.
The family crest was a 'Double Balloonflower' like that of the Jimyoin family.
They inherited the hereditary art of sacred music and dance 'Kagura'.
They inherited the hereditary art of sacred music and dance 'Kagura'.
They inherited the hereditary art of sacred music and dance 'Kagura.'

sen.j: 江戸時代前期に権大納言持明院基定の次男高野保春（1650年‐1712年）が持明院家から分家して高野家を創設したことに始まる。
sen.e: The Takano family started in the first half of the Edo period when Yasuharu (1650-1712, the second son of Provisional Major Counselor Motosada JIMYOIN) branched from the Jimyoin family.
The Takano family started during the first half of the Edo period when Yasuharu (1650-1712, the second son of Provisional Major Counselor Motosada JIMYOIN) branched off from the Jimyoin family.

The Takano family started during the first half of the Edo period when Yasuharu (1650-1712, the second son of Gon Dainagon (provisional chief councilor of state) Motosada JIMYOIN) branched off from the Jimyoin family.
The hereditary stipend during the Edo period was 150 koku.
Their hereditary stipend during the Edo period was 150 koku.
Their hereditary stipend during the Edo period was 150 koku.

sen.j: 歴代当主では保春が武家伝奏・正二位大納言に任ぜられたのが最高位で、その子高野保光も従二位大納言に任ぜられている。
sen.e: Yasuharu was appointed the official intermediary between the court and the bakufu called 'buke denso' Shonii (Senior Second Rank), which was the highest position the successive heads of the family attained; and Yasuharu's son Yasumitsu TAKANO was appointed Junii (Junior Second Rank) Major Counselor.

Yasuharu was appointed the official intermediary between the court and the bakufu called 'buke denso' Shonii (Senior Second Rank), which was the highest position the successive heads of the family attained; and Yasuharu's son Yasumitsu TAKANO was appointed Junii (Junior Second Rank) Major Counselor.

Yasuharu was appointed the official intermediary between the court and the bakufu called 'buke denso' Shonii (Senior Second Rank), which was the highest position the successive heads of the family attained; and Yasuharu's son Yasumitsu TAKANO was appointed Junii (Junior Second Rank) Dainagon (chief councilor of state).

sen.j: 贈位正三位高野隆古は宝暦事件に関与した勤皇21廷臣の一人だった。
sen.e: Posthumous Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) Takafuru TAKANO was one of the 22 court nobles band 'Kinno 22 teishin' who involved in the Horeki incident.
Posthumous Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) Takafuru TAKANO was one of the twenty-two court nobles band 'Kinno twenty-two teishin' who were involved in the Horeki incident.
Posthumous Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) Takafuru TAKANO was one of the twenty-two court nobles band 'Kinno twenty-two teishin' who were involved in the Horeki Incident.

sen.j: 明治時代に華族に列せられ、明治17年（1884年）従三位近衛府高野保建が子爵になった。
sen.e: In the Meiji period, the family ranked as nobility; and in 1884, Yasutake TAKANO (Jusanmi -Junior Third Rank, the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards) became viscount.
During the Meiji period, the family ranked as nobility; and in 1884, Yasutake TAKANO (Jusanmi -Junior Third Rank, the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards) became a viscount.
During the Meiji period, the family ranked as nobility; and in 1884, Yasutake TAKANO (Jusanmi -Junior Third Rank, the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards) became a viscount.
